blog.title: not all those who wander are lost
blog.description:
haley, 21 she/her there is some good in this world,
and it's worth fighting for

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Hey! I was just rereading your asoiaf/Hogwarts AU and (sorry if you've said before) but I was wondering which house you put the...
question: Hey! I was just rereading your asoiaf/Hogwarts AU and (sorry if you've said before) but I was wondering which house you put the Starklings in?
answer:
Aw, thank you! And to answer your question, I once wrote out what House I thought each Starkling should be in, but I lost that paper, so I have to with my gut right now in this moment. (Plus, that was like 5 years ago, I would probably disagree with at least one of them, and still have to remake it lol)

Robb is a pure Gryffindor to me. Bran a pure Ravenclaw. Like, I do not doubt these two at all and I will stand by these Houses to the end.

I can’t really get a read on Rickon’s House. I don’t think he would be in Ravenclaw or Slytherin, probably a Gryff or a Puff, but he’s so young in the books and also not a POV character, so it’s hard to get a good grasp on his core personality traits that could help determine a House. We mainly get wild, which suggests Gryffindor, but I still don’t know. I feel Gryffindor wins, but it’s close.

Arya I feel would be both a good Gryffindor and a good Hufflepuff. I would accept either one of these in a story, and I don’t really have a preference. I Sort her into Hufflepuff just to have a good mix with all the Houses for the Starklings, but I also think she would have been a close Gryffindor and the Sorting Hat took their time in Sorting her before making a final decision.

Sansa is like Arya, a mix between two Houses and a good fit for both, these two being Ravenclaw and Slytherin. As a Slytherin and one whose favorite character is Sansa, I Sort her into Slytherin. Plus as I mentioned with Arya, it gives a Stark to each House, with Rickon honestly going anywhere, but for my sake Gryffindor.

And then last, but so not least, Jon. He actually has the exact opposite problem as Rickon. I actually find it hard to Sort Jon into a House because I find he fits into all of them well. I truly don’t care what House he’s in.

That said, my inner Jonsa shipper finds the idea of Sansa and Jon in Slytherin, both good people grabbling with the history of the House and what their place in the future could be. Sansa from a line of Starks (never concentrated into one House, but they would never be a Slytherin), finding herself under the tutelage of Charms Professor Baelish, and Jon, the scion of well-gossiped about affair between Rhaegar Targaryen and Lyanna Snow, (a Stark cousin in fact) who doesn’t want to follow in the footsteps of his family, but doesn’t see a way out until he meets a Hufflepuff in need, Samwell Tarly.

But that’s not the asoiaf/hp fusion series, and for that, I think Jon could be in any House, and probably Gryffindor just based on gut feeling.

Does that help?

(To be probably too nerdy, I also calculated where each Starkling would be with each other by year. Assuming their ages go within their actual school years [as we don’t know birthdays, and if one was born in September or August to bring them down or up by a year], it would be:

Sansa’s First year-Robb and Jon are fourth years

Arya’s first year-Sansa is a third year, Robb and Jon are sixth years

Bran’s first year-Arya is a third year, Sansa is a fifth year

Rickon’s first year-Bran is a fifth year, Arya is a seventh year)

blog.name: acourtofhopeanddreams

blog.description:
Open your heart
To the love of the world
It only needs one person
Touching it with 
A word
A look
A smile
A kiss

title: Song of Ice and Fire
body:
Written for @jonsansasource Day 2: ASOIAF or GoT

Jon is a composer looking for a singer, Sansa is a singer looking for songs to sing. It’s a match made in heaven.

Modern AU

“Hello?” The ticks of Sansa’s high heels echoed all around her. The lack of light made it almost impossible for her to see anything and a shiver rolled down her spine while she wrapped her arms around herself in an attempt to keep herself calm. “I’m here for the audition?” She bit her lip and resisted the urge to check her phone once more.

This was the correct address. She had written it down two times. She had checked it four times and she had even walked the route a few days ago already to make sure she wouldn’t get lost today.

“Hello?” She swallowed. Due to the absolute silence she could hear her own heart beating in her chest.

What if someone pulled a prank on her? What if this audition was fake? What if somehow this was a trick to get her drugged and force her to do things she didn’t even want to think about?

She had read those stories. She had seen the warnings all of the internet. And yet, she had not thought that this audition was one of those things. It had seemed too real and when she had googled the composer she had found way more information about him that she had wanted.

Like that one picture where he was playing his guitar, a frown on his forehead and a concentrated look on his face. His long black curls covered half of his face, but somehow Sansa had been mesmerized by the photo.

“Jon? Jon Snow?” She was just about to turn around when the lights all of a sudden turned on. A high pitched scream escaped her lips and Sansa didn’t dare to look at the door opening behind her.

“I’m so sorry…” A warm, deep voice interrupted the deafening silence and a man with a guitar case hurried past her towards the corner of the room. “I promise I’m usually never late.” He started to unpack his backpack and case, plugging both the microphone and the guitar in. “Ghost, my dog, thought this was the perfect moment to feed himself my cables. I had to get new ones to give you a fair chance.” Finally he looked up and his eyes widened while his jaws dropped when his glance met hers.

“Jon Snow?” Sansa straightened her back and lifted her chin. Her heartbeat had not fully slowed down yet and she could stil feel chicken skin covering her entire body. But with as much confidence as she could muster she walked towards the young man and held out her hand. “I’m Sansa Stark. I came here for the audition?”

Jon kept on staring at her when he placed his hand in hers and shook it. “Jon, Jon Snow.” He let out a deep breath and almost stumbled over his own feet when he walked backwards to continue getting everything ready. “But you already know that, else you wouldn’t be here.”

Strangely enough his clumsiness eased her nerves a little and Sansa’s smile relaxed slightly while she watched how he placed the guitar on a chair and tried to guess the right height for the microphone.

His hands trembled a little while he searched for his sheet music. He was not exactly what Sansa had expected, but right now she was not sure if that was a bad or maybe more of a good thing.

“I don’t know if you’ll like the songs.” Jon looked up and shrugged. “I mean, I’m looking for a singer and the sooner the better, but…” He scratched the back of his neck. “If you don’t like it, you can say you don’t wanna do this. It’s not just me picking you, it’s you picking me too.”

Sansa nodded and despite this being her audition, she got the feeling that she was the one having to make him feel at ease. “I’m sure everything will be fine.” She walked towards the music stand and stared at the song, at the tones, at the lyrics. She had never been that good at reading and singing straight from the sheet, but with the right musical arrangement, she would hopefully not fail too badly.

“Are you ready?” Jon walked to the seat in the corner and reached for his guitar. His fingers tuned the strings a little and then he nodded at her once more. “Do you want something to drink first? Water? Tea?” He swallowed, as if he all of sudden realized he should have asked her this before showing her the sheet music and grabbing his guitar.

“I’ll be fine. I drank something at home and warmed up my voice. I’m ready when you are.” Sansa smiled at him and then she stared at the sheet music again. “You’ve picked an interesting title here.” She cocked her head slightly. “A Song of Ice and Fire.”

“It’s just…” Jon paused for a moment. “It’s just a working title. If this works out between us, we can go over the text and title together and see if we have to change anything.”

Sansa shook her head. “I meant it as a compliment, Jon. I like it. It stands out. It’s different.” She reached for the microphone and took it out of the stand. “Whenever you start playing, I’ll start singing.” She smiled once more and waited.

For a few long seconds nothing happened, but then Jon’s fingers started to move, started to play. The intro of his song echoed through the room, sounding so different from her ticking heals and her high pitched scream. In a way his song was mesmerizing and enchanting and Sansa almost forgot that she was supposed to add the lyrics.

But as soon as she started singing, she felt everything click and come together. She had no problem following the melody, perfectly harmonizing with the chords from the guitar. And even though the lyrics were brand new to her, she didn’t stutter and didn’t trip over words. This was what her voice was made for. This was what she had been looking for all this time.

When the song was eventually over she didn’t want to open her eyes, but the silence slowly drove away the magical feeling and she could no longer live in a moment that had already passed. “That was…”

“Enchanting.” Jon finished her sentence and jumped up from his seat, his guitar still in his hands. “That was perfect. Absolutely perfect.” He placed a hand on her shoulder. “That was how I wanted the song to sound, how it sounded in my dreams…” He kissed her cheek, but as soon as he realized what he had done he stepped back. “I’m sorry, that was…”

“It’s okay.” Sansa smiled and she pressed the palm of her hand to his cheek. “I recognize a perfect match when I feel one.” She pecked his cheek too and then she stepped back. “One more song before we grab a coffee to talk over the details of our musical future?”

Jon nodded eagerly and he searched for another sheet of music.

But that one song turned into three and into ten. And eventually those ten songs turned into a lifetime of songs and love.

Jon kept on staring at her when he placed his hand in hers and shook it. “Jon, Jon Snow.” He let out a deep breath and almost stumbled over his own feet when he walked backwards to continue getting everything ready. “But you already know that, else you wouldn’t be here.”

Strangely enough his clumsiness eased her nerves a little and Sansa’s smile relaxed slightly while she watched how he placed the guitar on a chair and tried to guess the right height for the microphone.

His hands trembled a little while he searched for his sheet music. He was not exactly what Sansa had expected, but right now she was not sure if that was a bad or maybe more of a good thing.

“I don’t know if you’ll like the songs.” Jon looked up and shrugged. “I mean, I’m looking for a singer and the sooner the better, but…” He scratched the back of his neck. “If you don’t like it, you can say you don’t wanna do this. It’s not just me picking you, it’s you picking me too.”

Sansa nodded and despite this being her audition, she got the feeling that she was the one having to make him feel at ease. “I’m sure everything will be fine.” She walked towards the music stand and stared at the song, at the tones, at the lyrics. She had never been that good at reading and singing straight from the sheet, but with the right musical arrangement, she would hopefully not fail too badly.

“Are you ready?” Jon walked to the seat in the corner and reached for his guitar. His fingers tuned the strings a little and then he nodded at her once more. “Do you want something to drink first? Water? Tea?” He swallowed, as if he all of sudden realized he should have asked her this before showing her the sheet music and grabbing his guitar.

“I’ll be fine. I drank something at home and warmed up my voice. I’m ready when you are.” Sansa smiled at him and then she stared at the sheet music again. “You’ve picked an interesting title here.” She cocked her head slightly. “A Song of Ice and Fire.”

“It’s just…” Jon paused for a moment. “It’s just a working title. If this works out between us, we can go over the text and title together and see if we have to change anything.”

Sansa shook her head. “I meant it as a compliment, Jon. I like it. It stands out. It’s different.” She reached for the microphone and took it out of the stand. “Whenever you start playing, I’ll start singing.” She smiled once more and waited.

For a few long seconds nothing happened, but then Jon’s fingers started to move, started to play. The intro of his song echoed through the room, sounding so different from her ticking heals and her high pitched scream. In a way his song was mesmerizing and enchanting and Sansa almost forgot that she was supposed to add the lyrics.

But as soon as she started singing, she felt everything click and come together. She had no problem following the melody, perfectly harmonizing with the chords from the guitar. And even though the lyrics were brand new to her, she didn’t stutter and didn’t trip over words. This was what her voice was made for. This was what she had been looking for all this time.

When the song was eventually over she didn’t want to open her eyes, but the silence slowly drove away the magical feeling and she could no longer live in a moment that had already passed. “That was…”

“Enchanting.” Jon finished her sentence and jumped up from his seat, his guitar still in his hands. “That was perfect. Absolutely perfect.” He placed a hand on her shoulder. “That was how I wanted the song to sound, how it sounded in my dreams…” He kissed her cheek, but as soon as he realized what he had done he stepped back. “I’m sorry, that was…”

“It’s okay.” Sansa smiled and she pressed the palm of her hand to his cheek. “I recognize a perfect match when I feel one.” She pecked his cheek too and then she stepped back. “One more song before we grab a coffee to talk over the details of our musical future?”

Jon nodded eagerly and he searched for another sheet of music.

But that one song turned into three and into ten. And eventually those ten songs turned into a lifetime of songs and love.
trail.content:
Written for @jonsansasource Day 2: ASOIAF or GoT

Jon is a composer looking for a singer, Sansa is a singer looking for songs to sing. It’s a match made in heaven.

Modern AU

“Hello?” The ticks of Sansa’s high heels echoed all around her. The lack of light made it almost impossible for her to see anything and a shiver rolled down her spine while she wrapped her arms around herself in an attempt to keep herself calm. “I’m here for the audition?” She bit her lip and resisted the urge to check her phone once more.

This was the correct address. She had written it down two times. She had checked it four times and she had even walked the route a few days ago already to make sure she wouldn’t get lost today.

“Hello?” She swallowed. Due to the absolute silence she could hear her own heart beating in her chest.

What if someone pulled a prank on her? What if this audition was fake? What if somehow this was a trick to get her drugged and force her to do things she didn’t even want to think about?

She had read those stories. She had seen the warnings all of the internet. And yet, she had not thought that this audition was one of those things. It had seemed too real and when she had googled the composer she had found way more information about him that she had wanted.

Like that one picture where he was playing his guitar, a frown on his forehead and a concentrated look on his face. His long black curls covered half of his face, but somehow Sansa had been mesmerized by the photo.

“Jon? Jon Snow?” She was just about to turn around when the lights all of a sudden turned on. A high pitched scream escaped her lips and Sansa didn’t dare to look at the door opening behind her.

“I’m so sorry…” A warm, deep voice interrupted the deafening silence and a man with a guitar case hurried past her towards the corner of the room. “I promise I’m usually never late.” He started to unpack his backpack and case, plugging both the microphone and the guitar in. “Ghost, my dog, thought this was the perfect moment to feed himself my cables. I had to get new ones to give you a fair chance.” Finally he looked up and his eyes widened while his jaws dropped when his glance met hers.

“Jon Snow?” Sansa straightened her back and lifted her chin. Her heartbeat had not fully slowed down yet and she could stil feel chicken skin covering her entire body. But with as much confidence as she could muster she walked towards the young man and held out her hand. “I’m Sansa Stark. I came here for the audition?”

Jon kept on staring at her when he placed his hand in hers and shook it. “Jon, Jon Snow.” He let out a deep breath and almost stumbled over his own feet when he walked backwards to continue getting everything ready. “But you already know that, else you wouldn’t be here.”

Strangely enough his clumsiness eased her nerves a little and Sansa’s smile relaxed slightly while she watched how he placed the guitar on a chair and tried to guess the right height for the microphone.

His hands trembled a little while he searched for his sheet music. He was not exactly what Sansa had expected, but right now she was not sure if that was a bad or maybe more of a good thing.

“I don’t know if you’ll like the songs.” Jon looked up and shrugged. “I mean, I’m looking for a singer and the sooner the better, but…” He scratched the back of his neck. “If you don’t like it, you can say you don’t wanna do this. It’s not just me picking you, it’s you picking me too.”

Sansa nodded and despite this being her audition, she got the feeling that she was the one having to make him feel at ease. “I’m sure everything will be fine.” She walked towards the music stand and stared at the song, at the tones, at the lyrics. She had never been that good at reading and singing straight from the sheet, but with the right musical arrangement, she would hopefully not fail too badly.

“Are you ready?” Jon walked to the seat in the corner and reached for his guitar. His fingers tuned the strings a little and then he nodded at her once more. “Do you want something to drink first? Water? Tea?” He swallowed, as if he all of sudden realized he should have asked her this before showing her the sheet music and grabbing his guitar.

“I’ll be fine. I drank something at home and warmed up my voice. I’m ready when you are.” Sansa smiled at him and then she stared at the sheet music again. “You’ve picked an interesting title here.” She cocked her head slightly. “A Song of Ice and Fire.”

“It’s just…” Jon paused for a moment. “It’s just a working title. If this works out between us, we can go over the text and title together and see if we have to change anything.”

Sansa shook her head. “I meant it as a compliment, Jon. I like it. It stands out. It’s different.” She reached for the microphone and took it out of the stand. “Whenever you start playing, I’ll start singing.” She smiled once more and waited.

For a few long seconds nothing happened, but then Jon’s fingers started to move, started to play. The intro of his song echoed through the room, sounding so different from her ticking heals and her high pitched scream. In a way his song was mesmerizing and enchanting and Sansa almost forgot that she was supposed to add the lyrics.

But as soon as she started singing, she felt everything click and come together. She had no problem following the melody, perfectly harmonizing with the chords from the guitar. And even though the lyrics were brand new to her, she didn’t stutter and didn’t trip over words. This was what her voice was made for. This was what she had been looking for all this time.

When the song was eventually over she didn’t want to open her eyes, but the silence slowly drove away the magical feeling and she could no longer live in a moment that had already passed. “That was…”

“Enchanting.” Jon finished her sentence and jumped up from his seat, his guitar still in his hands. “That was perfect. Absolutely perfect.” He placed a hand on her shoulder. “That was how I wanted the song to sound, how it sounded in my dreams…” He kissed her cheek, but as soon as he realized what he had done he stepped back. “I’m sorry, that was…”

“It’s okay.” Sansa smiled and she pressed the palm of her hand to his cheek. “I recognize a perfect match when I feel one.” She pecked his cheek too and then she stepped back. “One more song before we grab a coffee to talk over the details of our musical future?”

Jon nodded eagerly and he searched for another sheet of music.

But that one song turned into three and into ten. And eventually those ten songs turned into a lifetime of songs and love.

summary: Arya and Sansa + Practical Magic AU: “Did you or your sister kill Petyr Baelish?” “Oh yeah. A couple of times.” The Stark...
caption:
Arya and Sansa + Practical Magic AU:

“Did you or your sister kill Petyr Baelish?”

“Oh yeah. A couple of times.”

The Stark sisters were born into a life of magic. After their mother dies of a broken heart the pragmatic Arya swears to never fall in love while the dreamy Sansa can’t wait for romance. A singularly gifted witch, Arya chooses to stay at the Winterfell manor and carry on the family business of witchcraft. Sansa leaves home for an exciting life in the big city where she charms everyone she meets and draws the attention of a mysterious, but dangerous man. He brings dark and unnatural forces into the sisters life. And a young detective. Gendry Waters is investigating the strange circumstances surrounding Arya and she can’t help but be drawn to him too. Together Arya and Sansa will defeat an ancient evil, break the curse…and discover true love.

summary: "She will be singing to the Stranger, begging for his kiss". Sansan shippers say this is a reference to the Unkiss, and counts...
question: "She will be singing to the Stranger, begging for his kiss". Sansan shippers say this is a reference to the Unkiss, and counts as Sansan foreshadowing, due to Sandors horse being named Stranger, and his connection to death. God I hope not. What do you think?
answer:
No, they’re wrong. Here’s the passage it came from:

The queen bristled. “I most certainly have not forgotten that little she-wolf.” She refused to say the girl’s name. “I ought to have shown her to the black cells as the daughter of a traitor, but instead I made her part of mine own household. She shared my hearth and hall, played with my own children. I fed her, dressed her, tried to make her a little less ignorant about the world, and how did she repay me for my kindness? She helped murder my son. When we find the Imp, we will find the Lady Sansa too. She is not dead … but before I am done with her, I promise you, she will be singing to the Stranger, begging for his kiss.”

The context is Cersei wanting to torture Sansa because Cersei thinks Sansa helped kill Joffrey. There’s no romantic connotations. Besides the Stranger is one of the deities the Andals worship.

And the seventh face … the Stranger was neither male nor female, yet both, ever the outcast, the wanderer from far places, less and more than human, unknown and unknowable. 

SanSan isn’t ever happening. Sandor has served his purpose in Sansa’s story. His arc will come to an end at some point and I can assure you it doesn’t involve him marrying Sansa.

summary: fic summary: sansa/melisandre where sansa is somehow raised as a red priestess
question: fic summary: sansa/melisandre where sansa is somehow raised as a red priestess
answer:
Melisandre brings the girl to her chambers after the night fires are lit and worship is given to their red god. This new young alcolyte captivates her in a way she can’t explain, in a way that doesn’t make sense. This girl from the Sunset Kingdoms, so scared and far from home. It reminds her of someone she knew once, though she can’t recall. Melony, a voice chimes in the back of her head, but Melisandre pushes it away, as she’s grown used to doing over the years. She turns her attention back on the girl. Sansa, she says her name is when asked. Sansa Stark. She has yet to learn that family names and noble houses serve no purpose here, in the shadows of Asshai. Melisandre draws Sansa to her side, sits her down as she begins to runs a brush through her long, auburn hair. Melisandre watches the strands, entranced, as she makes her passes. In the firelight, copper dances through the girls hair, red and gold as well. Melisandre is jealous, she had to use any number of glamors to craft her appearance, but this girl… Kissed by fire, an errant thought, blessed by R’hllor. Melisandre presses a kiss of her own to the crown of her head. 

Send me a summary of the fic you wish I would write

This new young alcolyte captivates her in a way she can’t explain, in a way that doesn’t make sense. This girl from the Sunset Kingdoms, so scared and far from home. It reminds her of someone she knew once, though she can’t recall. Melony, a voice chimes in the back of her head, but Melisandre pushes it away, as she’s grown used to doing over the years. She turns her attention back on the girl. Sansa, she says her name is when asked. Sansa Stark. She has yet to learn that family names and noble houses serve no purpose here, in the shadows of Asshai. Melisandre draws Sansa to her side, sits her down as she begins to runs a brush through her long, auburn hair. Melisandre watches the strands, entranced, as she makes her passes. In the firelight, copper dances through the girls hair, red and gold as well. Melisandre is jealous, she had to use any number of glamors to craft her appearance, but this girl… Kissed by fire, an errant thought, blessed by R’hllor. Melisandre presses a kiss of her own to the crown of her head. 

Send me a summary of the fic you wish I would write

It reminds her of someone she knew once, though she can’t recall. Melony, a voice chimes in the back of her head, but Melisandre pushes it away, as she’s grown used to doing over the years. She turns her attention back on the girl. Sansa, she says her name is when asked. Sansa Stark. She has yet to learn that family names and noble houses serve no purpose here, in the shadows of Asshai. Melisandre draws Sansa to her side, sits her down as she begins to runs a brush through her long, auburn hair. Melisandre watches the strands, entranced, as she makes her passes. In the firelight, copper dances through the girls hair, red and gold as well. Melisandre is jealous, she had to use any number of glamors to craft her appearance, but this girl… Kissed by fire, an errant thought, blessed by R’hllor. Melisandre presses a kiss of her own to the crown of her head.
